comments.body: Si, porque seguiremos la paridad porque Java tendrá algo que tiene bedrock
Friends is an Xbox/Playstation thing, it's just intergrated into Minecraft because it's Bedrock Edition and on those platforms.
Yes please!
Completely agree not sure why this was never implemented on Bedrock we can already left click for file paths and farmland
I agree, but just so you both locate and locate biome are on bedrock now. But locate poi and place would be so cool on Bedrock.
I think this will be cool if added to java
Yam
Indeed
Also add F3 screen , advancement showing on screen per world and sweeping/critical hits as same combat system in both versions

Character skin parity! I looove the customisability on bedrock but I want to play on Java, without mod limitations.  and Redstone mechanics! I recently built something on bedrock to find that the redstone mechanics are not quite the same?
Hi
Hi
For was
Sharpness also gives off the blue particles I believe.

On my laptop, clicking is locked for like 2 to 3 seconds after pressing a key on the keyboard, making it more infuriating (and a bit uncomfortable) to play on a touchpad (I have a Dell Latitude E6540). Yes, I do have an external mouse, but it doesn't want to work with my laptop…

Here’s the problem with this: Bedrock DOESN’T have full keyboard control. I mean, they say they do, and have a toggle to turn it on, but without a crosshairs (at least on mobile) its impossible to break or place blocks because there is nothing on the screen to select the blocks. It acts as though the blocks you are placing/breaking are too far away. Otherwise, I would use my Bluetooth keyboard to play Minecraft. Every other control works like a charm on Minecraft with iOS but placing and breaking since there is no crosshairs.
this is an amazing idea

i think minecraft java DESPERATELY need to add a full keyboard gameplay im used to playing minecraft education edition and i changed the controls because it was way to hard to play i recenty bought the PC gamepass or whatever its called so i could see whats so good about java, it is pretty good so far except the gameplay options
No.  Java should only get the Goat Horn when bedrock gets candles.  Both editions are missing a feature, and it should stay that way until both are fixed.
And sculk sensors. We don’t have them yet.
i think the candles and the goat horn should be fixed now
Amber
Add goat horns to java edition in the 1.19 wild update!!

+1 here. Working on a marketplace project for the store and it's so annoying to make custom blocks for every single model that we want to change, instead of editing existing ones like in Java.

Another reason Java is superior to Bedrock.

+1. This also needs to happen in the Resource Packs, not Behaviour packs.

It also feels silly to have general rules on block models (1 pixel in block space etc) outside of marketplace content. Let us do what we want to do lol.
I want this

The BIG reason this is necessary: two-way flying machines. It is currently almost impossible to make a two way flying machine in bedrock.
This eliminates (redstone) elevators as even a possibility on bedrock and is my biggest frustration playing it.
For those who don't understand the mechanics of one-tick sticky pistons, this is what makes flying machines possible in Java.  In other words:  WE NEED THIS ON BEDROCK.
Even if QC won’t happen on Bedrock, this sticky piston mechanic should be in Bedrock.
This is my suggestion to allow big SMP’s to be played.
Yes that needs to in cuz when I’m playing with my sister, my 5 friends, and 2 of my friends’ brother, SOME CANT JOIN
great idea: and we also don't want to use online and pay

Although I don’t play multiplayer on Bedrock, this should technically be easy to implement. Minecraft Education Edition, which has a limit of 30 players, uses the same coding language as Bedrock. This means a copy-paste from the former to the latter should work.
It's not too useful but still a good thing to have.I won't get mad if they don't add it.
That's Bedrock Parity. Java Parity is when you want a Java feature in Bedrock.
Ah yes, you are correct. I understood it the other way around :P Title is now edited.

"Alternatively, an option could be added to disable or enable the categories."

I like this solution best.

Actually, it's only Blue Ice that gives off light in Bedrock Edition (it has a light level of 4), the other two ice types do not. Blue Ice was added to Bedrock Edition before it came to Java Edition, so it seems like it was always intended to give off light. So I'm not sure why they didn't give it a light level when they added Blue Ice to Java Edition.

While it isn't really a big deal compared to many of the other parity requests, it just seems strange that this particular thing is different between the two versions. It kind of feels like they just forgot to add it.

Blue Ice is currently the only block in the game with a light level of 4, so this could open up some new opportunities for Java Edition builders. And while this would have a very minimal impact on gameplay overall, I think it's always good to give the players more options to create interesting environments using lighting, and it would also make ice biomes feel a little bit more special.

In the Java version of the game Redstone gives off a gentle aura of usefulness. I find this very useful for machines and would have very cool effects on the machines that they would be built into but of course it’s not in the Bedrock version. Please make it so that Redstone can give off usefulness in the Bedrock version of the game as well. Thank you.
It can already do that.

I'm unable to do it in Bedrock. Imagine three half slabs in a row, mid air. fence posts underneath the outer two, then three fence posts under it all. I am unable to hang a bell in the middle, from the centre half slab. I tried to hang it from the underside of stairs and that didn't work either.

Unless it works in the snapshots now?
Then this should be in the Parity section then and not the Blocks, Tools, and Items section.
Thanks - I've moved it. I just did some more testing and on the current release this is definitely the case.
This should be in the Parity section then.
Thanks I moved it over
Minecraft does not have microblocks. Unless I'm misunderstanding.
What are microblocks?

Actually, this should be in another forum, not in Parity. Parity is when a vanilla feature from certain platform is not in the other (Bedrock/PC). PC does have a mod for microblocks but it's not a vanilla feature, not from the Minecraft team.
Why does ostrich have more votes than this??
It is better to add microblocks to minecraft

The specific seeds may need to be different because of how Bedrock uses a smaller number value to calculate seeds. FYI, seed 0 (grinnerslaphappier.org) is the same biome in both platforms, but beyond a range I don't know off the top of my head, your results vary widely. Structures and placement will always differ, though.

But yes, this feature would be very helpful in Java for someone to learn what seeds do, and get people straight-away to the "best of".

The only part where I see this not working out so well is if and when terrain generation is changed in Java. The "seed picker" would totally break, and "replacement seeds" would have to be found, if finding them at all is even possible. For that reason, I don't really expect this to happen, but hey... cool if it did!

This is a gameplay change that should have been done in both platforms, and for the same reason. Insta-break Silverfish Stone prevents someone from avoiding those by stopping if mining the block seems to take "too long." Why is this not already on both platforms?
We need signs without spaces between them so we can build with them connected

The bedrock's flying system is better imo. It allows for more precise movements and was implemented based on the console edition flight, which allows you to place blocks at the same speed you fly. It's pretty much essential for console players because of the inherent lack of precision from the controller itself
In my opinion it would be fine if the current Bedrock flight could be platform-specific, if console players find it easier. On Win10 it should be like Java.
The flight mechanics in bedrock/java editions should be a menu option, IMHO
Totally agree, while some prefer it, it should be an option. It's very disorienting to me, and is one of the few things making windows 10 edition feel inauthentic.

Created a new parity item to break out the flight ending when you land vs. the movement mechanics into a separate thing, as there may be different opinions on the two parts of the mechanics: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360071966971--Java-Parity-Creative-mode-flight-should-end-when-you-land
It's so anoying that Bedrock keeps the search, it is consuming me a lot of time. Maybe a setting?
add what???
What is vignette? Please enlighten us all

Hi there,

The title really doesn't say it all, unfortunately. 

Can you explain what you're looking for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

Sorry guys but I was kind of rushing then, but vignette is a dark shadow effect that is shown on the corners of the screen and it gives the game an epic feel. It's also exclusive on the Java edition so bring it to the bedrock edition please. Thank you.
